description:
The story is set on Okinawa's isolated island of Iwado, which has seen a growing movement advocating a return to an autonomous government. Ao Fukai, a 12-year-old boy with a missing father, lives on the island with an old doctor named Toshio and is about to enter middle school. Ao's mother was taken away a decade ago by unknown individuals. Naru Arata, Ao's 12-year-old childhood friend and the story's heroine, lives with her father, older sister, and grandmother. She has a "Yuta" power awakened within her due to an incident when she was young. A mysterious entity called "Secret" suddenly appears and launches an attack on the Scub Coral lifeform on the island. Ao launches a certain military FP called "Nirvash" aboard a Japanese military transport in his fervent desire to protect the island.

(Source: FUNimation)

node.description:
Shouji Kawamori is an anime creator, director and mechanical designer. Also a current advisor for [Satelight](https://anilist.co/studio/41/).

Famous for his work in the [Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088/) and Transformers franchises. He pioneered several innovative concepts in his works, such as transforming mecha (including the VF-1 Valkyrie in Macross and Optimus Prime in Transformers) and virtual idols (including Lynn Minmay and Sharon Apple in the Macross franchise).

Kawamori attended Keio University together with Macross screenwriter [Hiroshi Oonogi](https://anilist.co/staff/97701/) and character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/). There they became friends and founded a [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/) fan club called "Gunsight One," a name the group would use years later during the development of the fictional world of the Macross series. Later on his career Kawamori created or co-created the concepts which served as basis for several anime series. His projects are usually noted to contain strong themes of love, war, spirituality or mysticism, and ecological concern.

Kawamori also helped to design various toys for the Takara toyline, Diaclone in the early '80s. Among them the first Optimus Prime toy design, Prowl, Bluestreak, Smokescreen, Ironhide, and Ratchet. Over 20 years later, he returned to Transformers by designing both the Hybrid Style Convoy and the Masterpiece version of Starscream for Takara.

__[Website](http://www.flow-official.jp/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLakaKEelmUdqQISLjwIRmg)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/FLOWofficial.music)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/FLOW_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/FLOW_OFFICIAL_JAPAN/)__

FLOW is a Japanese rock band that formed in 1998 and is signed on to Sony Music Japan's Ki/oon Records label. Flow is a five-piece band made up of two vocalists, a drummer, a bassist and a guitarist.

__Members:__
- [Keigo Hayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/227206/Keigo) (林圭吾) | KEIGO  - Vocalist
- [Kohshi Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/160032) (浅川甲史) | KOHSHI - Vocalist, Occasional rhythm guitarist
- [Takeshi Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/160033) (浅川岳史) | TAKE  - Lead Guitarist
- Hiroshi Iwasaki | IWASAKI (岩崎博詞) - Drummer
- Yasutaro Gotou | GOT'S (後藤康太郎) - Bass

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tomoki_kyoda/)

Influenced by Hiroyuki Nakano's commercials and music videos, he studied video art at the Musashino Art University, joining Gento Matsumoto's company Sal Brunei as a graphic designer. He soon changed his occupation to the animation industry, having aspired to be an animation director since his childhood. 

He initially joined [Group TAC](https://anilist.co/studio/86/Group-TAC) where he worked as episode director and storyboard artist under the guidance of [Mitsuru Hongou](https://anilist.co/staff/103366/Mitsuru-Hongou). His first major role was as mechanical/creature designer on [Chikyuu Bouei Kazoku](https://anilist.co/anime/1962/The-Daichis--Earths-Defense-Family/), working alongside [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/Shouji-Kawamori) and [Kazutaka Miyatake](https://anilist.co/staff/100987/Kazutaka-Miyatake), with whom he would collaborate profusely afterwards. 

He later moved to studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/bones) landing as assistant director for [Yutaka Izubuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/99075/Yutaka-Izubuchi)'s [RahXephon](https://anilist.co/anime/165/RahXephon/). The two became close collaborators, with Kyouda soon taking the leading role on the [RahXephon: Pluralitas Concentio](https://anilist.co/anime/758/RahXephon-The-Motion-Picture/) movie.

Soon after, he directed [Eureka Seven](https://anilist.co/anime/237/Eureka-Seven/), incorporating his love for music and different sub-cultures into mecha anime.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tomoki_kyoda/)

Influenced by Hiroyuki Nakano's commercials and music videos, he studied video art at the Musashino Art University, joining Gento Matsumoto's company Sal Brunei as a graphic designer. He soon changed his occupation to the animation industry, having aspired to be an animation director since his childhood. 

He initially joined [Group TAC](https://anilist.co/studio/86/Group-TAC) where he worked as episode director and storyboard artist under the guidance of [Mitsuru Hongou](https://anilist.co/staff/103366/Mitsuru-Hongou). His first major role was as mechanical/creature designer on [Chikyuu Bouei Kazoku](https://anilist.co/anime/1962/The-Daichis--Earths-Defense-Family/), working alongside [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/Shouji-Kawamori) and [Kazutaka Miyatake](https://anilist.co/staff/100987/Kazutaka-Miyatake), with whom he would collaborate profusely afterwards. 

He later moved to studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/bones) landing as assistant director for [Yutaka Izubuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/99075/Yutaka-Izubuchi)'s [RahXephon](https://anilist.co/anime/165/RahXephon/). The two became close collaborators, with Kyouda soon taking the leading role on the [RahXephon: Pluralitas Concentio](https://anilist.co/anime/758/RahXephon-The-Motion-Picture/) movie.

Soon after, he directed [Eureka Seven](https://anilist.co/anime/237/Eureka-Seven/), incorporating his love for music and different sub-cultures into mecha anime.

Akira Amemiya is an animator and up-and-coming director best known for directing [SSSS.GRIDMAN](https://anilist.co/anime/99424/SSSSGRIDMAN) and being Studio Trigger founder [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/Hiroyuki-Imaishi)'s protege. Amemiya's [animation and directing](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/mini-imaishi.mp4) is very similar to Imaishi's yet is less chaotic and contains more 'retro' devices like impact frames and multi-tonal shading, drawing a lot of inspiration from [Masami Obari](https://anilist.co/staff/100660/Masami-Obari). For these reasons he was frequently typecasted for old school pose-heavy mecha combat.

Amemiya is a nerdy director whose anime often heavily references other series and artists he loves, sometimes even replicating Obari's [animation sequences](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/dangaioh2.mp4) and [layouts](https://i.imgur.com/nTRdM4K.jpg), [Transformer](https://twitter.com/SSS_SGRID/status/1051063114022572033)'s color designs, and Hideaki Anno's [establishing shots](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/welcome-to-the-anno-class.jpg) as well as long-lingering framing. Amemiya called Anno's [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Evangelion/) his [favorite series before](https://i.imgur.com/nEYK186.png). Between his ode-heavy artistry he interjects personality with [subtle details](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/what-kind-of-brand-is-TOMATO-LIFE-tho.jpg), visual gags, and repurposing tonally contrasting homages into a different context.

Amemiya graduated from Tokyo University of Technology and was part of the university's anime research society. During his time there he became heavily influenced by Osaka University's anime research club [Group CAS](https://twitter.com/group_cas). At the time [Toshiyuki Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/107357/Toshiyuki-Satou) was part of the group, while [Ikehata Hiroshi](https://anilist.co/staff/120505/Ikehata-Hiroshi) visited regularly. After a bit of indie work Amemiya joined studio Gainax and climbed up the hierarchy: from clean-up to animation direction, onto storyboarding and episode directing, until after joining studio Trigger and co-directing Kill la Kill finally having the credentials to debut with his own series.

He is married to animator [Megumi Kouno](https://anilist.co/staff/120602/Megumi-Kouno).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/123099499)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sekise10) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=yutaka_nakamura) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/中村豊_(アニメーター%29)

Yutaka Nakamura graduated from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and first joined studio Ad Cosmo. After switching several studios; from Art Office Sharaku, to Anime Torotoro, to [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), he eventually settled at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/) with a contract.

Nakamura is considered to be among the best action animators, with his scenes featuring catchy movement and effects. Some of his recognizable traits include camera shaking, blurs, and bending and stretching high-speed objects. His fights are praised for its weighty, intense choreographies that are heavy on impact frames. His signature trait is drawing debris as simple cubes, consequentially named "Yutapon Cubes," which are stylistic and easy to draw. Despite being responsible for popularizing it, Nakamura has stated that he started doing it when he noticed [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/) doing it. 

(Source: Animators Wiki)

STEREOPONY is a Japanese rock band that formed in Okinawa, Japan in 2008 consisting of NOHANA (Bass Guitar), AIMI (Lead Guitar/Lead Vocals), and SHIHO (Drums). Their song Hitohira no Hanabira (ヒトヒラのハナビラ) is the current ending theme for the anime series Bleach. Their first single was released on November 5, 2008. It ranked 25 on the Oricon Weekly Charts. They will be performing "Namida no Mukou (泪のムコウ)" as the second opening song for Mobile Suit Gundam 00 Second Season.

[Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=naoyuki_konno)

__Naoyuki Konno__ is a Japanese animator and director. He is particularly known for his work on several adaptations of [Shoutarou Ishinomori's](https://anilist.co/staff/97478/Shoutarou-Ishinomori) works as well as his animation style, being renowned as one of the Kanada-school animators.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gallo44_yoshida)

Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/122813934)

Originating from Studio Fuga.

Affiliated with [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KANETAKE)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/zachbolton6)

Also a line producer.

Originating from Eagle Nest. Currently freelance.

Tanaka first drew attention for the wild and imaginative fight sequences in Precure [Max Heart](https://anilist.co/anime/1929/) and [Splash Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1534/). Following this he expanded his scope and took up work on productions all around the industry, showing that fights aren't everything he can do. His variety on running sequences, often showing an effiminate touch, as well as the particular attention to hair, down to all little strains and often involving a hairdo having a life of its own, are some of Tanaka's most outstanding feats.

__Non-anime credits:__
~!
- Chief Animator, Animation Character Design, Storyboard, Director, Animation Director, Key Animation for "BlazBlue: Calamity Trigger (OP)" (video game, 2008)
- Key Animation for "Disgaea D2: A Brighter Darkness (OP)" (video game, 2013)
- Key Animation for "livetune adding Fukase (from SEKAI NO OWARI) 「Take Your Way」" (music video, 2013)
- Key Animation for "Rurouni Kenshin: Meiji Kenkaku Romantan Saisen (OP)" (video game, 2011)
- Key Animation for "Valkyria Chronicles III" (video game, 2011)!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanzakihiro) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLww4xTaLWjpESsK2HzkkcA) | [Nico Nico Douga](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/1159685/mylist?ref=pc_userpage_menu) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/27557) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/user-658062794)

Animator, illustrator and composer.

Uses the pen name Hanasoumen-P (鼻そうめんP) or HSP for his Vocaloid work.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanzakihiro) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLww4xTaLWjpESsK2HzkkcA) | [Nico Nico Douga](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/1159685/mylist?ref=pc_userpage_menu) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/27557) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/user-658062794)

Animator, illustrator and composer.

Uses the pen name Hanasoumen-P (鼻そうめんP) or HSP for his Vocaloid work.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/igarashi_takuya)

Formerly part of [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). Currently freelance with ties to studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9D%91%E6%9C%A8%E9%9D%96)

Yasushi Muraki is an animator and an occasional director affiliated with [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

Admired [Ichirou Itano](https://anilist.co/staff/103268/) and [Masami Oobari](https://anilist.co/staff/100660/), and became an animator. He is skilled in mechanical and action animation, and is one of three animators alongside [Hideaki Anno](https://anilist.co/staff/100111/) and [Masami Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/129865/) who are said to have fully mastered the "Itano Circus" drawing technique. He was invited to join the production of [Eureka Seven](https://anilist.co/anime/237/) by [Kenichi Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/103498/), who was in charge of character designs and became the special effects director of the series, fully demonstrating his skills.

(Source: Wikipedia)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山根公利)

Lama is a Japanese supergroup consisting of former Supercar members Kōji Nakamura and Miki Furukawa, along with Hisako Tabuchi and Kensuke Ushio.

[Official Website](http://www.lama.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LAMAtwi)

__Members:__
• Miki Furukawa (フルカワミキ) - vocals, bass [(Twitter)](https://twitter.com/furukawamiki)
• Kōji Nakamura (中村弘二) a.k.a. Nakako (ナカコー) - vocals, guitar [(Twitter)](https://twitter.com/iLLTTER)
• Hisako Tabuchi (田渕ひさ子) - guitar, chorus [(Twitter)](https://twitter.com/__hisako)
• Kensuke Ushio (牛尾憲輔), a.k.a. agraph - programming [(Twitter)](https://twitter.com/agraph)

Nakamura Koji is a Japanese musician who is most famous for being the lead singer/songwriter of the band Supercar. His music style in general involves drone-like guitar riffs and mixed in raw electronica. He presently records music under the name iLL.  In 2011, Nakamura and former Supercar member Miki Furukawa formed the band LAMA.

The four members first met while attending the Berklee College of Music in Boston, Massachusetts.   The name "Hemenway" comes from a street name in Boston, where the four members lived close by and had unforgettable memories.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/musashisakai00)
A fast and highly regarded action animator. Friends with [Tetsuya Nishio](https://anilist.co/staff/103725/) since their junior high school days.
